dct_title_s: A NEW AND EXACT MAP of AMERICA AND ILANDS THE REVNTO BELONGING
dct_description_sm: California as an island of Briggs type with flat northern coast which turns northeast at C. Blanco. Includes P. Sr. Francesco Draco and P. de Carinde (misspelling of Carmel).
First published in 1666 to be sold by Thomas Jenner, then published in or with A Map of the whole world , Thomas Jenner, publ., London, 1668.
Note within title cartouche: Published and are to be Sold by John Garrett at the South Entrance unto Royal Exchange of London.
Engraved by: W.Hollar fecit (lower left, to right of title cartouche).
dct_publisher_sm: John Garrett at the South Entrance into Royal Exchange of London.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
